main_definition: A document containing a series of questions used to gather information, opinions or feedback from individuals.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An instrument for collecting data by asking a series of predefined questions.
meanings_and_examples.example: The survey consisted of 20 questions designed to understand customer satisfaction with our services.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A tool used in research or studies to obtain structured information from respondents.
meanings_and_examples.example: For the market research study, participants were asked to fill out a detailed questionnaire about their shopping habits.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An online form containing questions that individuals can answer at their convenience.
meanings_and_examples.example: The university sent an online questionnaire via email for alumni feedback on job placements after graduation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A set of written or electronic queries used to probe a subject matter in-depth, often employed in interviews.
meanings_and_examples.example: During the interview process, candidates were asked a series of open-ended questions as part of the questionnaire.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A list of specific questions designed for educational assessment or evaluation purposes.
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher handed out a questionnaire to each student to evaluate their understanding of the new topic discussed in class.
